DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Chemotherapy Radiation Therapy Relationship Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator whether radiation therapy, treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation, or chemotherapy, use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases, had a causal influence on an observed adverse event, any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure._the yes/no/unknown indicator related to adverse events.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Chemotherapy Radiation Therapy Relationship
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to radiation therapy, treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation, or chemotherapy, use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases, as having a causal influence on an observed adverse event, any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An unwanted effect caused by a drug or therapy.  Such effects can be drug related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another drug, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ObjectClass.changeDescription: Change concept code to C41331 as C2861 is retired per EVS. dw

Property.preferredDefinition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term may be used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, it is most commonly used to refer to the variety of chemical-based agents employed to treat cancer.  Cancer chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells.  Because cancer cells usually divide much faster than normal cells, they are often very sensitive to the inhibitory actions of chemotherapeutic agents.  Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity. (NCI04):use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:Related; connected or associated.

Concepts.definition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient experienced a
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient experienced any adverse event that is serious (grade 3 or 4 unexpected, or any grade 5) and possibly related to R-04 chemotherapy/radiation therapy that has not been previously reported?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Adverse Event Ind-3 (2018376v1) with VD Yes No Unknown Indicator (3506034v1)
